required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Satisfaction and Long-term Anatomic Efficacy Study on Patients Who Underwent a Richter Intervention in the Obstetric and Gynecology Department of Foch Hospital Since 2008
clinical_study.official_title: Satisfaction and Long-term Anatomic Efficacy Study on Patients Who Underwent a Richter Intervention in the Obstetric and Gynecology Department of Foch Hospital Since 2008

brief_summary.textblock: Satisfaction and Long-term Anatomic Efficacy will be assessed on Patients Who Underwent a Richter Intervention in the Obstetric and Gynecology Department of Foch Hospital Since 2008.

detailed_description.textblock: Satisfaction and Long-term Anatomic Efficacy will be assessed on Patients Who Underwent a Richter Intervention in the Obstetric and Gynecology Department of Foch Hospital Since 2008.

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term satisfaction of the Richter procedure
primary_outcome.description: It will be ask to the patients to evaluate their satisfaction of the procedure, base on a 4-answer scale ("Not at all satisfied", "Not very satisfied", "Moderately satisfied", "Fully satisfied")

secondary_outcome.measure: Long term anatomic impact of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: An optional gynecological consult is proposed to the patients
Post-operative complications will be collected and compared to the anatomic impact of the procedure and the patient satisfaction

intervention.description: Patient will be asked to assess their satisfaction concerning the Richter procedure and its long term effect
The Quality of life will be assessed with 3 questionnaires (I-Qol / PISQ-12/PFDI-20)
An optional gynecological consult is proposed to the patients to better estimate the gynecological long-term impact of the procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient who underwent a Richter intervention between 01/01/2008 and 31/12/2017 in the Gynecology Department of Foch Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
